intro: Ochrosia hamakuaensis, commonly known as the Kona whiteflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a lush green backdrop to its showy blooms. Ochrosia hamakuaensis is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological significance in Hawaiian flora.
